material.mattext: How does an embedded system communicate with the outside world?

To connect electronic components to a power source
To mount electronic components for easy assembly
To store electronic components for later use
To connect electronic components together for prototyping

How many negative rails does the breadboard have?

Can you connect multiple breadboards together to create a larger prototyping area? How would you do this?
No, breadboards cannot be connected together
It depends on the specific breadboards being used
Yes, by using jumper wires to connect the power rails of each breadboard together
Yes, by connecting both arduino microcontrollers

They have a wider range of applications compared to microprocessors
They have built-in memory and I/O peripherals
They require external memory and I/O peripherals
They are more expensive than microprocessors

Get hardware and software components ready
Plan how to execute the project

More efficient use of processing time
Which of the following is an advantage of using an RTOS in microcontrollers?
More efficient use of processing time
Ability to handle multiple tasks in real-time

The way they handle data and program memory
The number of instructions they can execute
What is the purpose of an IoT gateway?
To store data from IoT devices
To provide a secure connection between IoT devices and the internet
To process data from IoT devices

Which of the following is a recommended security measure for IoT devices?
A network of physical devices connected to the internet and capable of exchanging data
A type of internet connection used exclusively by IoT devices
A type of operating system used in IoT devices
A protocol used to secure IoT devices
What is the role of security by design in IoT devices?
To integrate security features into IoT devices during the design phase
To add security features to IoT devices after they have been released
To perform regular security audits of IoT devices
To educate users about security risks associated with IoT devices.
What is the role of sensors in IoT devices?
To display information on a screen
To collect data from the environment and send it to the device
To provide power to the device
To connect to other IoT devices

Which one of the following is a volatile memory device?
A group of IoT devices that communicate with each otherbb
The software and hardware components that make up an IoT device
The network that connects IoT devices to the internet
The entire network of connected devices, gateways, and cloud services
What one or more of the following describes an Embedded System?
Embedded systems is a subset of IoT.
IoT is a subset of Embedded systems.
Which of the following is an example of an IoT gateway?
What is the purpose of a cloud service in IoT?
To store and analyze data from IoT devices
To provide additional security to IoT devices
To act as a backup power source for IoT devices

IoT devices do not need microcontrollers
IoT devices use the internet for sharing data

What is the function of an actuator?
To detect changes in the environment
To convert electrical energy into mechanical energy
To sense the presence of objects

What is the function of an actuator in an IoT device?
To control physical devices in response to data collected by the sensors
To store data collected by the sensors
To provide power to the device
To convert electrical energy into mechanical energy

To execute a block of code a certain number of times.
To loop through a block of code until a certain condition is met.

What is the function of the reset button on the Arduino Uno board?
It turns off the power to the board.
It erases the program from the microcontroller.
It restarts the program from the beginning.
It allows the user to switch between programming and running modes.
What is the purpose of the onboard LED on the Arduino board?
It provides power to the board.
It is used as an input device.
It is used as an output device for debugging and status indication.
It is used to program the microcontroller.
What is the maximum current that can be drawn from a single digital output pin on the Arduino Uno board?
What is the purpose of the EEPROM on the Arduino board?
It stores the program code for the microcontroller.
It provides non-volatile memory storage for data that needs to be retained after the board is powered off.
It provides a backup power source for the board.
It regulates the voltage on the board.

Which of the following is NOT a type of Arduino board?
What is the purpose of the Serial.begin() function in the Arduino programming language?
It initializes serial communication on the Arduino board.
It sets the mode of a pin to either input or output.
It reads the current state of a pin.
It writes a value to a pin.
Which of the following is a function of the LiquidCrystal library in the Arduino programming language?
Displaying text on an LCD screen
Sending data over a wireless connection
What is the purpose of the tone() function in the Arduino programming language?
It generates a square wave of a specific frequency on a digital output pin.
It generates a sine wave of a specific frequency on a digital output pin.
It generates a random waveform on a digital output pin.
It generates a pulse wave of a specific frequency on a digital output pin.
Which of the following communication protocols is NOT supported by the Arduino board?
What is the purpose of the millis() function in the Arduino programming language?
It returns the number of milliseconds since the board was last reset.
It sets the mode of a pin to either input or output.
It reads the current state of a pin.
It writes a value to a pin.
What is the purpose of the delay() function in the Arduino programming language?
It causes the program to pause for a specified amount of time in seconds.
It causes the program to pause for a specified amount of time in microseconds
It causes the program to pause for a specified amount of time in milliseconds
It causes the program to pause for a specified amount of time in macroseconds
